<tr>
  <td class="left">[http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javadesktop/ProjectWonderlandWorkingWithModules05 Working with Modules]</td>
  <td class="right">This tutorial describes the basics of the Open Wonderland module system and how to install modules. Modules allow developers to extend the functionality of the platform by providing custom code and/or content.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td class="left">[https://wonderland.dev.java.net/wiki/beginner/Wonderland_Tutorial_01.pdf Tutorial for Beginners]</td>
  <td class="right">These two tutorials ([https://wonderland.dev.java.net/wiki/beginner/Wonderland_Tutorial_01.pdf Part 1], [https://wonderland.dev.java.net/wiki/beginner/Wonderland_Tutorial_02.pdf Part 2]) by Douglas Finnigan provide a high-level introduction to Open Wonderland for developers, describing basic concepts for all of its technologies.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
  <td class="left">[http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javadesktop/ProjectWonderlandDevelopingNewCell05 Developing a New Cell]</td>
  <td class="right">The primary means to extend Open Wonderland is by developing a new kind of Cell. There are a number of tutorials, from basic and advanced on this page. The following four-part tutorial series goes in-depth for developers on how to create a new Cell: [http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javadesktop/ProjectWonderlandDevelopingNewCell05Part1 Part 1], [http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javadesktop/ProjectWonderlandDevelopingNewCell05Part2 Part 2], [http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javadesktop/ProjectWonderlandDevelopingNewCell05Part3 Part 3], [http://wiki.java.net/bin/view/Javadesktop/ProjectWonderlandDevelopingNewCell05Part4 Part 4].</td>
</tr>
